metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31810 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Ruby through 2.6.7, 2.7.x through 2.7.3, and 3.x through 3.0.1. A malicious FTP server can use the PASV response to trick Net::FTP into connecting back to a given IP address and port. This potentially makes curl extract information about services that are otherwise private and not disclosed (e.g., the attacker can conduct port scans and service banner extractions).

notes.Note: leosilva> for xenial, the backport can be kind of intrusive. for now ignoring it.

criterions.comment: ruby2.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
